Support added for iOS 10 v4.0.3 - Fix bug that affects Siri speech recognition

Support added for iOS 9 v4.0.1:
- Fix an issue that stops Siri reading out weather details for some devices
- Fix an issue that stops Siri answering more than the first question for some people

v4.0.0:
- Support added for iOS 8.3 and iOS 8.4
- Support added for Assistant+ - get Wake With Weather to perform activator actions or give set responses using the tweak Assistant+
v3.2.4 - Fix temperatures being read out with many decimal places

v3.2.3 - Stop wake with weather starting when a countdown timer stops

v3.2.2
- Fix handling multiple questions using a language not supported by Wake With Weather
- Fix issue some people had where Wake With Weather would launch when alarm was snoozed even if "Activate On Snooze" setting was disabled.

v3.2.1 - Fix not reading weather details for some iOS 8 users
v3.2.0 - Added support for iOS 8 and the iPhone 6
Added support for iOS 8 and the iPhone 6

Added better support for Celsius on the iPad. Added a setting to force the temperature to be read out either in Fahrenheit or Celsius. Fixed Siri launching but not reading weather for some people on iOS 7.1.2. Added support for Activator 1.9.0 Initial support for iOS 7.1.1. With this version iOS 7.1.1 users will have to press the home button twice to exit Siri after the alarm is cleared and the weather is read. Otherwise it should be fully functional. v3.1.0:
- Added support for Mandarin (Simplified Chinese and Traditional Chinese) and Cantonese (已加入对普通话及粤语Siri的支持) - a big thanks to Alex for his help.
- Fixed problem where Wake With Weather wouldn't work for some people or would try to show a calendar event instead of the weather.
- Fixed reading out emails and messages when there is another question following the email or message question.
- Fixed problem where it wouldn't start the weather after unlock on the iPad.
- Fixed crashing other applications on start up for some users.

v3.0.0:
- Added support for iOS 7 and the iPhone 5S.
- Added support for Korean (한국어), thanks to 철이와다애 for help with translation (번역이 많이 부족하더라도 이해해주세요. 감사합니다).
- Added support for reading out reminders when a custom question about reminders is used and "Read All Events" is set to on.
- Added an option to activate even if the alarm is snoozed.
- Added options for inter question delay and inter sentence delay for to slow things down for people who think the information comes too quickly.
- Improved compatibility with Siri ports for some iPhone 4 users.
v2.5.0:
- Rewritten to not depend on the AssistantExtensions library. Any users having issues with Siri being able to send messages or set reminders upgrade Wake With Weather and remove AssistantExtensions.
v2.4.1:
- Added support for Italian. A big thanks to Sergio Iannuzzi for his help.

v2.4.0:
- Added an activator listener so and activator action can be set to launch Siri and Wake With Weather.
- Added the feels like temperature to the same sentence as the current temperature when both are selected

v2.3.0:
- Added support for Spanish. A big thanks to Mineah and syd4j13 for their help.
- Fixed support for SnoozeOrStop.

v2.2.2:
- Fix compatibility with the tweaks Unfold and UnlockFX.
- Siri now says good morning to your nickname if you have one set.

Fix for Wake With Weather not starting for some iOS6 users.

Now support for iOS6 and iPhone 5. v2.1.0:
- Fix problem that stopped weather being read out when "Feels Like Temperature" is turned on due to a change in the weather data Siri receives.
- Say the name of the day when reading out calendar events for future days.
- Fix French time format.
- Fix German translation error.

v2.0.0:
- Added support for multiple questions for Siri to answer when the alarm is stopped.
- Added support for reading events from the Calendar.
- Wake With Weather now speaks German - A big thanks to Marko, Alex, Marvin and Mo for translating.
- Added support for the tweak SnoozeOrStop.
v1.1.1:
- Fix bug that makes settings in French for everyone

v 1.1.0:
- Wake With Weather now speaks French - A big thanks to Stéphane, Olivier and Zooropalg for translating.
- Added an option to say Good Morning.
- Added an option to say High and Low instead of Maximum and Minimum
